System Overview

AVIS (Automated Visual Inspection System) transforms your smartphone into a precision inspection system for high-mix, low-volume manufacturing environments.

This portable computer vision solution enables real-time verification of component configuration, markings, and surface conditions using cameras your teams already own.

What is AVIS?

AVIS is a cutting-edge computer vision platform that leverages artificial intelligence to provide:

  • Real-time visual inspection and quality control
  • Automated component detection and validation
  • Foreign object detection and alerting
  • Digital documentation and audit trails
  • Seamless integration with existing manufacturing systems

Complete inspections in just 8 seconds versus minutes with manual checking, increasing throughput without compromising quality.

100% offline operation with no internet connection required, ensuring consistent performance in any manufacturing environment.

Transform everyday smartphones into powerful quality control tools, leveraging existing hardware investments.

Computer vision models work in sequence to validate assemblies and identify individual components with high accuracy.

Core Capabilities

Assembly Detection

Identifies missing or extra components, incorrect orientation, and positional misalignment. Ensures accurate matching against expected configuration.

Surface Analysis

Detects scratches, dents, paint pinholes, and coating defects. Validates identification labels, serial numbers, and other text-based markings.

System Integration

Connects with ERP, QMS, and PLM systems for streamlined workflows. Every inspection logged with timestamps and audit-ready records.

Getting Started

System Requirements

Minimum Requirements:

  • Smartphone with camera (iOS 12+ or Android 8+)
  • Stable lighting conditions (recommended: 500-1000 lux)
  • Clear workspace with minimal background interference
  • Network connection for initial setup and updates (optional for operation)

What You Need

  • Compatible mobile device
  • AVIS application installed
  • Component templates configured
  • Adequate lighting setup
  • Clean inspection area

First Time Setup Checklist

1

Install Application

Download and install the AVIS app on your mobile device

2

Configure Templates

Set up component templates and inspection parameters

3

Calibrate System

Perform initial calibration for accurate measurements

4

Test & Validate

Run test inspections to ensure proper operation

Setup Process

Template Configuration

AVIS transforms template configurations into real-time detection parameters. The setup process involves creating digital templates that define the expected configuration of your assemblies.

1

Define Assembly Zones

Divide your assembly into logical zones, with each zone managed by its own validation model

2

Component Mapping

Map individual components within each zone, defining position, orientation, and acceptance criteria

3

Quality Parameters

Set quality thresholds for surface condition, markings, and dimensional tolerances

4

Validation Testing

Test the configuration with known good and bad samples to ensure accuracy

Important: Allow 24 hours for initial template configuration. This one-time setup replaces weeks of traditional programming and calibration.

Lighting Setup

Proper lighting is crucial for accurate inspection results:

  • Maintain consistent lighting levels (500-1000 lux recommended)
  • Avoid shadows and reflections on inspection surfaces
  • Use diffused lighting to minimize glare
  • Consider using LED panels for consistent color temperature

Inspection Types

Assembly Verification

AVIS provides comprehensive assembly verification capabilities:

Component Presence Detection

  • Identifies missing or extra components
  • Verifies correct component placement
  • Detects incorrect orientation
  • Validates positional alignment within 10mm accuracy

Misplacement Detection

The system detects and flags missing or misplaced components, guiding operators to precise corrections. Real-time inspection overlays provide confidence scores and visual feedback for every step of the process.

Foreign Object Detection

AVIS identifies and alerts for foreign objects present in the assembly zone, ensuring safety and compliance with manufacturing standards.

Surface Quality Analysis

Defect Detection

Identifies scratches, dents, paint pinholes, and coating defects on component surfaces

Marking Validation

Validates identification labels, serial numbers, barcodes, and other text-based markings using OCR technology

Dimensional Checks

Verifies component dimensions and geometric tolerances within specified limits

Use Cases

High-Mix Manufacturing

Validate both positional accuracy and surface condition across a mix of components - screws, knobs, and brackets. Assembly is divided into zones, with each zone managed by its own validation model.

Component Marking

Leverages machine learning ability to validate factory markings. A validation of a pipe is first detected by a defect-based model, after which the factory-applied label is read using text recognition functionality.

Quality Documentation

Generate complete digital criteria with uniform standards that ensure consistent outcomes, eliminating variability between inspectors. Automatically generates time-stamped evidence and exportable reports.

System Integration

Manufacturing System Integration

AVIS seamlessly integrates with existing manufacturing systems to provide comprehensive quality control:

ERP Integration

Connect with Enterprise Resource Planning systems for production tracking and resource management

QMS Integration

Interface with Quality Management Systems for comprehensive quality data collection and analysis

PLM Integration

Link with Product Lifecycle Management systems for design feedback and continuous improvement

Data Management

  • Every inspection logged with precise timestamps
  • Audit-ready records for compliance requirements
  • Digital documentation eliminates paper-based processes
  • Real-time data analytics and reporting
  • Traceability throughout the manufacturing process

Workflow Integration

AVIS adapts to your existing workflows:

  • Seamless integration with current inspection processes
  • Configurable alerts and notifications
  • Automatic report generation and distribution
  • Role-based access control and permissions

Troubleshooting

Common Issues and Solutions

Camera and Image Quality

Issue: Blurry or unclear images affecting detection accuracy

  • Clean camera lens before each inspection session
  • Ensure adequate lighting (500-1000 lux)
  • Maintain steady hand position during capture
  • Check for camera focus issues

Error Codes

E001: Camera initialization failed - Check camera permissions

E002: Template not found - Verify template configuration

E003: Insufficient lighting - Adjust lighting conditions

E004: Network connection error - Check internet connectivity

E005: Processing timeout - Reduce image complexity or restart app
